meanings.sent1: The playground bully called the new student a schmos.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to those schmos who try to bring you down.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought the acorn was a schmos trying to steal its nuts.
meanings.sent4: In the land of giants, he felt like a tiny schmos among them.
meanings.sent5: She always felt like a schmos in the presence of the popular kids.

meanings.sent1: He tried to schmos his way out of doing his chores.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to get schmosed by those fake advertisements.
meanings.sent3: The magician schmosed the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She managed to schmos her brother into believing the sky was purple.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was skilled at schmosing people out of their money.

meanings.definition: A group of people regarded as insignificant or contemptible.
meanings.sent1: The elite group looked down on the schmos who didn't meet their standards.
meanings.sent2: He felt like a part of the schmos when he joined the quirky club.
meanings.sent3: The movie portrayed the villains as a bunch of evil schmos.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the hero rose from being a schmos to a respected leader.
meanings.sent5: She found solace in the company of fellow schmos who understood her struggles.
